items.abstract:
<jats:sec><jats:title>Key content</jats:title><jats:p>
<jats:list list-type="bullet">

<jats:list-item><jats:p>Pregnant women should take 400 micrograms/day of folic acid periconceptionally.</jats:p></jats:list-item>

<jats:list-item><jats:p>Highdose vitamins C and E are not recommended.</jats:p></jats:list-item>

<jats:list-item><jats:p>All pregnant women are now advised to take vitamin D supplements.</jats:p></jats:list-item>

<jats:list-item><jats:p>Less than 50% of pregnant women in the UK take the vitamins recommended for pregnancy.</jats:p></jats:list-item>

<jats:list-item><jats:p>Further collaborative research is required to understand the role of other vitamins in improving maternal and perinatal wellbeing in high and lowresourced countries.</jats:p></jats:list-item>
</jats:list>
</jats:p></jats:sec><jats:sec><jats:title>Learning objectives</jats:title><jats:p>
<jats:list list-type="bullet">

<jats:list-item><jats:p>To understand the role of vitamins in pregnancy.</jats:p></jats:list-item>

<jats:list-item><jats:p>To gain an overview of recommendations on vitamin supplementation in pregnancy.</jats:p></jats:list-item>

<jats:list-item><jats:p>To be aware of the benefits and harm of vitamin supplementation in pregnancy.</jats:p></jats:list-item>
</jats:list>
</jats:p></jats:sec><jats:sec><jats:title>Ethical Issues</jats:title><jats:p>
<jats:list list-type="bullet">

<jats:list-item><jats:p>Is it appropriate to identify women at risk of vitamin deficiency based on parameters such as ethnicity and body mass index?</jats:p></jats:list-item>

<jats:list-item><jats:p>How should potential benefits and harms be balanced for mother and fetus when considering vitamin supplementation in pregnancy?</jats:p></jats:list-item>

<jats:list-item><jats:p>Is it ethical to consider food fortification with vitamins for the benefit of one group (pregnant women) when there may be harm for other groups (older persons)?</jats:p></jats:list-item>
</jats:list>
</jats:p></jats:sec>
title: Vitamin supplementation in pregnancy
